Headline: Attended Lovely Professional University
Comment:
Diamond chips are a rare find in the market, making them less visible and harder to come by. In contrast, Lay's chips dominate the shelves, making them widely available and easily accessible. This difference highlights the contrast in their market presence and brand reach.

Wholesalers and traders focus on selling only those products that are in high demand and bring them profit. Their goal is to maximize earnings by prioritizing fast-moving and profitable items.

Advertisement plays a significant role in boosting a product's visibility and demand. It helps create brand awareness, attract new customers, and ultimately drive sales.

The main factor in building any brand is money. Sufficient investment is essential for marketing, product development, and expanding reach, all of which are key to establishing a strong brand presence.

Headline: Founder & CEO @ Giggr Technologies | Design Learning | Building a Digitally Intelligent Platform As Service | Transforming Global Capability
Comment:
Rishabh Mariwala
I'm afraid your message is confusing and self-contradicting. 

Ideas get attention only at a theoretical level. Not at a Pragmatic / Practical level. 

Unlike the past when consumer behavior was / is shaped by Marketing & Advertising, the future will and should be shaped by experience. Data Continuum (From Creation to Consumption) should play a significant role.

Innovation has three parts - 
1️⃣ Mind to Market (Systemic or Unprecedented where the Customer doesn't know). 
2️⃣ Time to Market (Systems' or Out of the Box Approach to Application) where Theta Customers sitting on the fence adopt.
3️⃣ Continuous Improvement that reduces the transactional costs and therefore increases the customer base. 

What you call Product is essentially in the second and third stages of innovation. But before we get there, startups need to disrupt the marketplace and not just conform to how the grownups have created and sustained the marketplace. Especially in these times when our societies should move from the 200 years of Industrialization legacy to the next 200 years of an Intelligent Life. 

Happy to dialog if you are. 

#india #startups #entrepreneurship #team #execution

Headline: Bridging the gap between Architects and Consumers
Comment:
I think every team needs to have two type of people. One who has the analytical mind, he spots the problem with a foresight and creates a solution on paper. The other one is the executioner who details out the solution with the visionary and his team together, and starts executing it. 

They both need to be compatible and in sync to for better results.
